website_summaries.verdict: If you can afford this pricy monitor, its beautifully realistic 8K visuals are sure to surpass your expectations.
pros: Gorgeous 8K display is 4 times more detailed than 4K UHD
cons: Dell’s first 8K monitor comes with a hefty price tag

website_summaries.verdict: Viewing the incredible levels of detail and lifelike colours of this 32” 8K computer monitor will make it tough to go back to 4K.
cons: Its steep price will be a high hurdle for many potential buyers

customer_reviews.title: Really Great 8K Monitor, used for CAD.
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is excellent for CAD work as the resolution is beyond belief. Schematic circuit diagrams of great complexity can be displayed and the circuit can be viewed without the need to pan around, with the risk of confusing continuity of connection. A great product which is quite expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest Moorey

customer_reviews.title: they accept kidneys as payments
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to buy this but unfortunately I am a broke college student, apparently they accepted kidneys as payments so I took matters into my own hands (or my kidneys) so I kinda needed 2 kidneys but who needs kidneys anyways, this monitor is so smooth I cant even feel my body slowly dyi
customer_reviews.author: Alberto

customer_reviews.title: Changed my life
customer_reviews.text: Amazing resolution! As an adult film afficianado I find myself frequently lusting for greater quality in my depraved binge sessions. After turning tricks I found this to be quite affordable! It's worth the positive result from the clinic!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Feingold

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor, but price
customer_reviews.text: It's a great monitor, but the price is too high... I bough it for $4,000 but most likely the price will soon drop all the way bellow $1k
customer_reviews.author: Yunus Rajabiy

customer_reviews.title: Too powerful
customer_reviews.text: Very good monitor but is it to powerful answer yes after a while of gaming my eyes start to burn
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Holding out for Apple 10K
customer_reviews.text: Save your money until Apple destroys this with 10K, unless you're worried the first gen 10K won't have enough MagSafe ports for all your devices.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Too much glare, noisy in vertical position
customer_reviews.text: Would be a great screen if it was anti-glare. I bought 3 of them, and I am struggling to get used to the glare that makes it very difficult to use for a professional usage. Hopping to solve the issue by finding an anti-glare film. That's a shame. Also when put in vertical orientation, a cooling fan is constantly on which makes the screen very noisy.
customer_reviews.author: PF

customer_reviews.title: Eyeball explosion warning
customer_reviews.text: After using this for an evenings gaming my eyeballs both exploded.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.text: When I found out that amazon accepted brains as payments I instantly baught. thee down side was that i experienced less than a second of the 8k because i died😀

customer_reviews.title: The wrong specs are detailed it should be 7680 x 4320 if its 8K???
customer_reviews.text: The wrong specs are detailed it should be 7680 x 4320 if its 8K???
customer_reviews.author: Jakub Chmiel

customer_reviews.title: The best monitor on the market at the moment
customer_reviews.text: Owned the Dell 5k 27" before (UP2715K). This one also requires two DP cables to handle 8K/60Hz bandwidth. I have Radeon RX580 graphics card (with two DP ports) and it worked straight away with new monitor, no fiddling required. The picture quality is simply awesome, obviously this is not a gaming device but for other tasks there's nothing that can compare to this thing. Yes it is expensive but it's money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: B. Ledwig

customer_reviews.title: Scan Computers dont buy wont honour warranty
customer_reviews.text: Problem u have to buy it though Scan Computers and they have the wrong specs for its resolution should read 8K 7680 x 4320 at 60 Hz Typical Scan mistake, won't buy it now.
customer_reviews.author: Mr P Bassman
